TopicTitle: Just about ever human space launch....

Articles.Content:
So last night I was searching for an Excel template for my RL flight hour logging... got this bright idea to transfer all of my flight logs from my first lesson to today. I've had my private pilots license sense I was 16 years old and I turn 41 this year so.... its going to be a long summer.

Anyway... in my search I came across this... http://planet4589.org/space/logs/launchlog.txt It's list of just about every space launch from "Sputnik" to today...

This guy put a lot of work into getting all of this info into one sheet. I mean he's got everything from the date and time of the launches, payloads, launch vehicels and launch sites.

With a lot of time and work you could completely recreate the entire human space program.
Unfortunately, most of us got no time to recreate all of them...

Unfortunately, most of us got no time to recreate all of them...
LoL.... Right!!!!

That database sure took a lot of time and effort to compile and update every new launch.

Anyway, if you're talking about having a record of all your launches in KSP, I'm doing something similar to it - I'm recording every launch and tests I am doing on my New Save
